alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 7:45PM EST until January 12 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River At Rawlings affecting Brunswick and Dinwiddie Counties. Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River at Rawlings. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water begins to flow across Harpers Bridge Road about an 1/8 of a mile north of the river. Farm land north of river along Beaver Pond Creek also floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:35 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:35 PM EST Wednesday was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 11/13/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 745 AM EST.
